alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 10:20PM MST until December 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow accumulations will taper off in the next few hours with light accumulations expected. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills of 20 to 30 degrees below zero expected. * WHERE...Moscow, Potlatch, Pullman, Uniontown, Plummer, Rosalia, Tekoa, Genesee, Colfax, Oakesdale, and La Crosse. * WHEN...From 7 PM Wednesday to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to dangerous wind chills, blowing and drifting snow will be possible tonight into Wednesday as northeast winds develop.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
